intro: Dorstenia peruviana, commonly known as the Peruvian mountain vine, is a climbing plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its slender, twining stems and small, palmate leaves. The plant produces distinctive, tubular flowers that are typically greenish-yellow with a prominent stamen. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
